Posts.Content: Jul 5, 2010 02:33AM MaryGirl wrote: Hi Linda-  I had a bilateral mast with DIEP reconstruction 4 years ago.  I had a great recovery until 6 weeks after the surgery, when I developed pleural and pericardial effusions.  The shortness of breath was really scary.  Once it was finally diagnosed the doctor checked me into the hospital.  The doctors there assumed that it was due to the spread of cancer, even though I was only stage one.  To make a long story short, all tests came back negative.  No one could ever explain the cause of the effusions.  I agree with what someone else here said though.  Getting the effusion drained gave me immediate relief from the shortness of breath.  And sleeping propped up definitely helped with the breathing difficulties.  Hang in there.  I'll be praying for you and your family.  Mary
